item.title: This Tuscan startup sold all its olive oil in the U.S. Then came Trump's tariffs
item.description: Americans love olive oil — and import 95% of it. But tariffs are making it harder for Europeans to sell it to Americans.

item.title: Teen suicide is on the decline, new federal data shows
item.description: The 2024 National Survey on Drug Use and Health report found that in recent years, depression and suicidal thoughts and behaviors in teens have declin...

item.title: What's the deal with electrolyte drinks — do you need them to stay hydrated?
item.description: Seems like nobody's drinking plain water these days. Electrolyte packets or colorful sports drinks are everywhere. But do you need them?

item.title: The Presidential Fitness Test is coming back
item.description: NPR's Leila Fadel speaks with sports physician Jordan Metzl about President Trump's effort to revive the Presidential Fitness Test.

item.title: Can Psychedelic Therapy Go Mainstream?
item.description: Research shows that psychedelics can help with a range of mental health conditions, like PTSD and depression. So why can't you get them from your doct...
